front.title: Comparison of SNMPv3 Against AAA Network Access Requirements

abstract.t: This document presents an overview of SNMPv3 compliance with the AAA protocol requirements for network access as stipulated in the 'Network Access AAA Evaluation Criteria' Internet Draft dated April 26, 2000 [1]. SNMPv3 protocol features and capabilities directly support many of the AAA requirements. In addition, the more sophisticated management model (see Section 5, below) now underlying SNMP -- which has evolved from the original model introduced in the late 1980s under the guidance of extensive use in the field -- enables the design, development, and deployment of more sophisticated management applications geared to the overall body of AAA protocol requirements (or sub-sets thereof).
